intro: Lippia durangensis, commonly known as Mexican blueweed, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its aromatic, small blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in open woodlands and grasslands. Lippia durangensis has narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences. It is sometimes used in traditional medicine for its potential anti-inflammatory and antimicrobial properties.
